content:
I am looking at the Current Build IG and I see several different ways that 'plan network' is represented - different abbreviations, capitalization, and formatting.

I see "Plan<space>Net", "Plan<hyphen>net", "Plannet" (no spaces or dashes)", and "plannet-". What is the correct format we should when speaking of this? Obviously anything in a url should be used as is...but seeing so many variations may cause errors.

image.png

Should be Plan-Net. At the top of the page is the official name, which may indeed be "Plan Net", but that should be the only use.
I fixed a bunch of "Plan-net" in the text, including the "Plan-net" at the top of the page next to the artifacts summary.
The other things you are pointing out are artifacts of the build process.

Profiles are named: plannet-<Resource>.
Where it says "ResourceProfile:PlannetInsurancePlan" is a publisher construction.

Thanks for the comment.
